intro: Centaurea carellii, commonly known as the Carell's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers and spiny leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Centaurea carellii is often found in regions with Mediterranean climates, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
